file_content.text: I yield! Never have I witnessed such raw power....
The day and the planet are yours, I freely pass the scepter.
The threat Dellocon posed to you and your master has died with him. I hope it ingratiates me in some way.
I was looking forward to doing that myself.
You stole my kill.
You are above such trifling tasks. Let others like myself do such deeds for you.
You shouldn't have killed him.
That was not called for.
Why? Baras would not have accepted a show of mercy and you must not cross him... yet.
Thank you for ending that miserable wretch for me.
I appreciate it.
It's my fault he lived as long as he did.
It's clear to me now--someday you will rise above your master. It is you, not I, who will be Darth Baras's end.
Grant me mercy so I may live to see it. Honor me with some small hand in it.
Death is the only honor you've earned.
You must die. [Kill Rathari]
Then make it swift.
I make you my minion to be called into service when I see fit.
Swear yourself to me.
Yes. I shall wait with patience for your summons.
I leave you to your business, my lord. Remember, I am at your disposal, whenever you may seek to topple Baras.
From here on, that is your only interest in the galaxy.
Abandon all other ambitions.
You have siphoned all other ambition from me.
I may call on you, I may not.
We'll see.
I will live out my days hoping for the chance.
I've killed enough today. Make sure I never hear from you again.
You live, but disappear.
You have clipped my wings, humbled me. In one fell swoop, my boldness has been dashed.
I relinquish my station on this planet and within the Empire.
If you ever show yourself again, you're dead.
Never return.
There's more to the galaxy than domination and war.
Enjoy your retirement.
Just get out of here.
All right, Sith, now no one's left but you and me and my men. Your objective has been met.
May we go?
You have served me well, Commander. Leave in peace.
Yes, and thank you.
Your men can go but your days are over.
Not you. [Kill Naughlen]
Ahhhhhh...!
You heard my lord, Republic grunts--consider yourselves lucky and flee.
What are you Republic fools standing around for? You heard my master--get out of here!
You men heard me. Unless you want to join Naughlen in death, flee!
Men, the commander would want us to persevere. Let's move out.
Go while you still can.
All right, men, you heard the Sith. Let's get back to our neck of the woods.
It will be good to get back to the ship and leave this planet.
Not fond of Nar Shaddaa, Quinn?
You don't like it here?
It's not often I agree so vehemently with Darth Baras, but this place is indeed the armpit of the galaxy.
Maybe you'd like it back on Balmorra.
Quit complaining.
Point taken, my lord. I stand corrected.
I'm sure Baras would appreciate your confirmation on that point.
I doubt he cares if you agree.
I'd just as soon you didn't mention it to him, my lord.
Let's be on our way.
Then we leave.
When we arrive back at the ship, I'll prepare it for flight.
Reserve your comments, Captain.
Keep it to yourself.
Yes, my lord. Forgive my impudence.
I think you have an eye for our little Twi'lek back at the ship.
Have you missed Vette, Quinn?
I'm not going to dignify that with a response.
Whenever you're ready to return to the ship, I'll prepare it for flight.
Glad this is finally over. Maybe we can go back to the ship and get off this rock, huh?
Lord Baras will be expecting an update.
It's time.
Well, say hi to him for me.
Just keep your comments to yourself.
Pipe down.
Yeah, I know the routine. Keep my mouth shut and take a sightseeing tour of all the finest places in the galaxy.
You haven't enjoyed Nar Shaddaa, Vette?
Not a fan?
What's to enjoy? It's so dark and scummy, gives me the creeps.
I just can't wait to get back to my quarters and grab some shut-eye.
Lord Rathari, I presume. Finally, we come face to face.
Ah, you showed. You lack your master's caution; I applaud that.
Dellocon, Baras's lackey is here. So say your piece, and do it before I kill this would-be assassin.
Baras is insane and paranoid! I was a faithful servant, and my cover was intact!
Did he expect me to accept being murdered for reassurance? Just wait for death?
You knew the risks of the job when you took it.
Comes with the territory.
And how to avoid them. Lord Rathari protects me now, and all of Baras's secrets will be his.
You will die in agony.
Your wait is about to end.
Come, speak with Baras, perhaps he'll listen to reason.
Why tell me?
Do you think I'm stupid? Not a chance.
Dellocon and everything he knows of your master's operations are mine now.
In a hundred years when I am legendary within the Sith, your and Baras's deaths at my hands will not even be a footnote.
However, I would never lower myself to duel a mere apprentice such as you. You haven't earned the honor.
I marked you as a coward the moment I saw you.
Too scared?
Ha! You cannot goad me into it, worm.
A Sith Lord should be a man of his word.
I thought you had honor.
So naive. Lies and deception are important weapons in every Sith's arsenal.
I'm ready to kill you however you choose to engage me.
I figured this was a trap.
You are every bit as infuriating as your master.
These men are my elite guard, trained to take on Sith. Half of them could kill you, but I don't like to play favorites.
Your men are going to be a little busy with my men.
I brought reinforcements, too.
That will make my victory all the more sweet.
I'm glad you invited everyone.
Time to end this farce.
I'm warning you, Rathari, stand down. Now.
You should surrender.
That's the signal, men! Let's go.
I see now--I've underestimated your resourcefulness.
Men, make quick work of these Republic fools. Attack!
Ha! I just played my checkmate move, and you expect me to give up? Time to end this farce.
All attack!
In that case, I'll destroy them all!
Let's fight already! [Attack]
Now men, attack!
So you brought your own army to the fight. Even better--kill everyone!
If you're in a hurry to die, I'm happy to oblige you. All attack!
